meanings.definition: The vital energy that is held to animate the body internally
meanings.sent1: She believed in the power of her chi to keep her strong and healthy.
meanings.sent2: Yoga and meditation can help balance your chi and improve your well-being.
meanings.sent3: When he drank his morning coffee, he joked that it was his chi fueling him for the day.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as a source of chi, radiating energy to those around her.
meanings.sent5: The ancient practice of Tai Chi focuses on harnessing and directing one's chi for health benefits.

meanings.definition: A Chinese unit of length equal to about 0.3 meters
meanings.sent1: The table was approximately one chi wide.
meanings.sent2: The fabric was measured in chis to ensure it was the right length.
meanings.sent3: She laughed when her friend guessed her height as three chis tall.
meanings.sent4: The road sign indicated the distance to the next town was two chis away.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter used a chi ruler to mark the wood for cutting.

meanings.definition: A letter of the Greek alphabet
meanings.sent1: In Greek class, they learned about the letter chi and its pronunciation.
meanings.sent2: The word 'chorus' starts with the letter chi in Greek.
meanings.sent3: He doodled the letter chi on his notebook while daydreaming in class.
meanings.sent4: The symbol for chi in the Greek alphabet resembles an 'X'.
meanings.sent5: The ancient text was written in Greek, with the letter chi appearing frequently.

meanings.definition: A letter of the Hebrew alphabet
meanings.sent1: The Hebrew word for 'life' starts with the letter chi.
meanings.sent2: She practiced writing the letter chi in Hebrew calligraphy.
meanings.sent3: During the lesson, they discussed the significance of the letter chi in Hebrew texts.
meanings.sent4: The Torah contains many instances of the letter chi in its verses.
meanings.sent5: The rabbi pointed to the letter chi on the board, explaining its meaning in the alphabet.
